title: How to properly "Entice" Morde into botlane while keeping solo intact.
body:
Harvester of Sorrow [w]: Cooldown ~~12 / 11 / 10 / 9 / 8~~ -> 24/22/20/18/16.

**NEW**: When cast on allied champions, Harvesters of Sorrow's cooldown is reduced by 50%.

WHAT IS OLD IS NOW NEW: Can be cast on Mordekaiser and allied minions.

--

This way it encourages Morde to cast W on allies, but does not remove a spell from him in a solo lane.

replies.body: i figured the "enticement" would be the double damage, not having an abysmal cooldown otherwise :s

Unless you mean "this is fine" as in the comic... He has taken 20% WR bot and lost 5 to 10 everywhere else.

Maybe because he has the lowest playrate and is ugly?
I love Urgot. He became a bit popular for like 2 month and now we're back to "existence is torment" level mood.

Allowing to cast Creeping Death when self casting or casting on a minion and Haversters of Sorrow when casted on an allied champion would be a better option than what you suggested. Or being able to self cast it for half the effectiveness for that matter.

But like I've said many times already. Allowing him to self cast it wont guarantee his solo laning restored. His base stats nerfs and lower abilities' base damages outside Glorious Q has molded him away from solo lane.
It's not an attempt to "restore" his solo laning, it will put it back intact.

And yet, you need also to delete the heal from w if cast on non-champion or he would be a sustain monster on solo lane, since he can heal himself for 400 every 20secs.

not in minion waves, lol. the heal from minions is pretty bad, but if he gets like 3 monsters or even just 1 champion it gets stupid good. IMO reduce the healing potency, from 3x as much as the minion heal to just double it or something

20 seconds is terrible for a heal, i can't think of anyone who has sustain on that high a cooldown
Master yi has a 35 second cooldown on mediate.

fair enough

but meditate also has nearly 70% damage reduction and doesn't require him to push a wave, and, you know, the reset passive on his ult

That's exactly what should be done. Don't punish players for playing Morde on other lanes than bot, rather reward him for playing bot lane. This change would be great, not only it would fix at least one of Morde's solo lane problems, but at the same time, it wouldn't make his duo lane more powerful. Something that should be implemented before rework left PBE or in hotfix but it wasn't. Eventually, I would take out the option of reactivating ability for heal or just make the heal weaker when using alone (and of course it shouldn't heal minions, that would be just super strong tool for farm denying). I hope Riot will already listen to us and implement such a change.
wouldn't doubling the cooldown punish him for going into solo lanes?

> [{quoted}](name=Solomon Money,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RsAzlucZ,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-08-30T15:31:54.818+0000)
>
> wouldn't doubling the cooldown punish him for going into solo lanes?

Isn't inability to cast W when alone already a punishment for going solo lane? It's better to have double cooldown and actually be able to cast spell than not even be able to do it. If heal would be left for use in solo lane, such long cooldown is justified, as that heal is quite strong, especially when you take into consideration Morde passive that is already giving him a lot of sustain (in such scenario, shorter cooldown would be a reward for using W on ally). But, if Riot decided to take away heal when self casting W (if they even decide to let Morde self cast it), then cooldown should not be doubled, with heal being reward for duo laning (with full exp and double damage Morde already gets when being duo). That's my stance on it.

that just creates a bigger burden of knowledge than he already has, we don't need more overloaded toolkits, especially when the ability used to be simple. just raise the cooldown on the early levels with no reduction for using it on an ally ( stupid change imo), make the DoT stronger damage-wise (over a longer period of time) and worse healing wise against minions or something

so dumb that it went from "mord can cast on either an ally or himself" to "mord will cast on an ally and he will get it, too" to "mord can only cast this with an ally nearby"

needs a major tweak imo

then let him self-cast it

tbh the ability's a little strong as it is by means of its "optimal use" situation. i don't think the damage should overlap, that way they can boost its damage output  to how it used to be before (but put the duration back to 6 seconds), while granting different utility (since Riot will probably keep the heal rather than return to the defense steroid, I guess we have to live with it) 

he's a more noticeable threat by himself but he's not ridiculously oppressive with an ally. that's what i think riot needs to go for.

Since this is 2015, let's add anther passive to that W.

I honestly don't know why people are so attached to solo lane Morde regardless. In a 1v1 scenario, Morde will always be unstoppable or trash due to the nature of his kit. I know that's how he played for years but Morde as a bot lane carry provides far more potential of being balanceable even if he isn't at this particular moment.

Solo lane Morde felt like shit because all it took was for the enemy jungler to camp you so that you didn't even get to play the game. Duo lane Morde feels much less hamstrung by this, 2v3's are way, way easier to deal with than 1v2's.

Yup, that right there is the difference between a good Morde and a bad one and hence why people just look easier and safer champions instead.

If its cast on Morde alone (not on a minion), it shouldn't give as much movespeed. The entire reason the 75 flat ms buff is balanced is because of the gameplay around having to be approaching your partner.
The movespeed bonus was there before the rework.

Here is another idea.

Pool Party Mordekaiser
Pool Party Sona

...nuff said.

...maybe Pool Party Ahri as well?
Dude I remember you duo trundle midlaner, this guy calls himself "the bronze gatekeeper."
Sounds like a good change honestly. Then again, any change that makes his W castable without allied champions present is better than the current iteration.

I think you missed the point.  The rework was MEANT to get Morde out of a solo lane because when he is strong enough to be viable, he is incredibly unbalanced.

Pre-rework Morde, and honestly, post-rework, too, suffers from the issue of completely lacking mobility as a melee bruiser.  Balance-wise, he is either strong enough to overcome this limitation, or he is easily kited.  If he is strong enough to make the lack of mobility irrelevant, then he is overpowered, because it also means he can simply ignore positioning and still stay healthy with high damage.

Slotting him into a bot lane carry position was meant to allow him to be that strong with farm, but need the help of the support to get that farm.  I don't believe that goal was actually achieved.  Morde still suffers from the same problem.  He is way too strong if he just has the minimum damage and survivability required for him to be viable.  He is being banned a lot at higher MMR, and his win rate in Plat and above is almost 60%.  That win rate also drops off dramatically as the game goes long, so perhaps there is some rebalancing to be done that can make his scaling better and early game less oppressive.

In the end, however, the issue is not that he was forced out of a solo lane.  When Morde was viable as a solo laner, he was every bit as toxic a champion as people think Riven is now.  CertainlyT attempted to do something interesting with him, but I just don't feel like it worked.  It was a good attempt, but it is time to just obliterate Morde completely and rework him from the ground up.

He is being banned a lot at higher MMR, and his win rate in Plat and above is almost 60%.  That win rate also drops off dramatically as the game goes long, so perhaps there is some rebalancing to be done that can make his scaling better and early game less oppressive.

> In the end, however, the issue is not that he was forced out of a solo lane.  When Morde was viable as a solo laner, he was every bit as toxic a champion as people think Riven is now.  CertainlyT attempted to do something interesting with him, but I just don't feel like it worked.  It was a good attempt, but it is time to just obliterate Morde completely and rework him from the ground up.

but how does it make him a less toxic duo laner?

Well, I don't think it worked, and I don't know if it CAN work.  The general idea, however, is that making a champion a sort of pseudo-ADC means you can weaken their early game, improve their scaling, and make them dependent on their team.  This allows them to build into their strengths later in the game and become the team's powerhouse, without being oppressive early on.  This is done in degrees, of course.  The hypercarries are much less effective early game, while the more bully ADC's fall off a little.  Still, ultimately, even late game, they will be doing a lot of the actual carrying, because they'll be the ones hurting the towers the most, and they still won't be able to stand toe-to-toe with the true early game bullies.

The Morde changes did effectively make him dependent on his team.  That is an absolute requirement to force someone into a duo lane, and so that is the aspect CertainlyT focused on primarily.  The changes to his W are very effective for their intended purpose.  The problem is that the rework failed on the other two aspects.  Morde's early game is still oppressive, and his late game is not, even with a good build.  His win rate in the ADC position on champion.gg shows that he is an extremely dominant force early, winning a whopping 60% of games that don't last much longer than the surrender timer.  His win rate late game is abysmal, however.

I understand that, as a melee champion, he needs more help early than the ranged carries do, and the tradeoff for that is his late game efficacy, but the numbers suggest that both were taken to the extreme.  They should make him weaker early, improve his scaling a little, and see where that leaves him.  Putting more power into the dragon in later ranks of the ult would give a clear objective and window of power for both his team and the opponent to exploit.  The only thing that would really remain to be seen is if there is ANY point at which his early game still leaves him viable without being overpowered.

That is where the greatest concern lies, largely because it is the same problem old Morde had.  That line between viable and overpowered simply didn't exist for solo lane Morde.  If it also does not exist for duo bot Morde, he'll be in need of a full-blown rework.  Personally, because the problem is so very similar, I believe that he will need a complete rework.

But they didn't have to force him into a duo lane he could have been just as viable as a duo laner without taking away his ability to solo lane. I don't even dislike his kit but he still feels like an old champ very awkward very clunky. Also nothing in his kit rewards skillful play, yes the 3rd Q is extremely satisfying but it feels punishing an opponent for their mistake than rewarding you for a good play even among the juggernauts he has an extremely brute force play style, kinda like a riven with the mobility supplemented by more damage.

How are people not getting this?  They WANTED to get him out of the solo lane, because solo lane Morde being viable has proven time and again to be utterly toxic to the game.  They tried to keep him as he is, for the most part, and that meant making him a duo lane champ.  They could have gone the easy route and made him a support, but they wanted to try something interesting.

Like I said, I'm not sure that interesting thing worked, so he may end up needing a full rework anyway, but the simple fact remains:

THE WHOLE PURPOSE OF THE REWORK WAS TO GET HIM OUT OF THE SOLO LANES.
